intro: Anisostachya triticea, commonly known as blue grama, is a perennial grass native to the central and southwestern United States. It is characterized by its fine, blue-green foliage and tufted growth habit, making it a common sight in grasslands and open woodlands. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that are typically pale green to blue in color. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in full sun and requiring minimal water. Anisostachya triticea plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife and livestock.
